keyValuePair.Value: Poor Pre-Season for %1s

%1s has been a disappointment in pre-season and fans of %2s are discussing as to whether he should start the first league game of the season. Normally one of the first names on the team sheet, the %3s needs to quickly find his form or face an unexpected spell on the sidelines.
%1s Fails to Shine

Fans of %1s are starting to feel concerned on the dawn of the new campaign due to the lack of sparkle from %2s. He's certainly been below par so far, but perhaps he just needs the first real competitive match to bring back his edge.
%1s Off to Slow Start
%1s has not been performing in pre-season. Now it's up to %2s to decide if it's the teams best interest to play him or to give a different player a chance in the first meaningful test of the season.
%1s Impresses in Pre-Season

%1s has been one of the revelations in pre-season for %2s. Not considered as one of the first names on the team sheet, he's put in some outstanding performances and pushed for a spot on the opening day of the season.
%1s Emerging as Pre-Season Surprise

You can't always pay much attention to pre-season form, but it's hard to ignore the performances of %1s who has looked to step up his game and give the manager a selection headache before the season gets underway

You can't always pay too much attention to pre-season form, but it's hard to ignore the performances of %1s who has looked to step his game up and give the manager a selection headache ahead of the season proper getting underway.
%1s a Revelation In %2s's Pre-Season

%1s has had a player with great potential emerge during pre-season. %2s used the pre-season matches to make a name for himself. %3s will have to give him serious consideration for the opening game of the season.

%1s has had a potentially vital player emerge during pre-season. %2s used the pre-season matches to make a name for himself. %3s will have to give him serious consideration for the opening game of the season.
Boss, I know I didn't have a great pre-season. There were reasons, I wasn't feeling 100% but I'm over it now so if you put me in against %1s I'll show you just how valuable I am for the team.
You're facing tough competition to make the starting lineup.
It's next to impossible that you'll get to play weekly given the tough competition you're facing from your teammates, unless you prove your worth with each opportunity you get
Nobody in the team is irreplaceable.
You need to pick yourself up. You need to work hard to earn your place in the squad and you should know that nobody in the team is irreplaceable.
You're a key player to my plans
We all have our ups and downs. You're a key player for %1s and I'm sure you'll pick up the pace when the season is up and running
We all have our ups and downs. You're a key player for %1s and I'm sure you'll pick up the pace when the season is at stake.
I hope you're going to include me in the squad against %1s. I've had a good pre-season and I'm feeling great.
I like to see that you're asking for more
You've shown great ambition to play since the beginning of the season and I like to see that you're asking for more. I'm sure you'll keep your composure in competitive matches.
You've shown great ambition to play since the beginning of the season and I like to see that you're asking for more. I'm sure you'll keep your composure in competitive matches.
I might go with a more experienced lineup
%1s, I am fully aware of your form but I believe I'll go with a more experienced lineup to set the tone for the rest of the season. I'll consider your game time moving forward.
%1s, I am fully aware of your form but I believe I'll go with a more experienced lineup to set the tone for the rest of the season. I'll consider your game time moving forward.
Competitive matches are a different business
You've done great in pre-season but competitive matches are more demanding. You'll get your shot when the time is right
%1s Back To Form As Season Begins

Much of the speculation before the game was whether %1s would keep faith with %2s given he had hardly set the world alight in pre-season. The %3s boss decided to give his %4s another chance to find his form, and he was rewarded with an excellent display.
%1s Disappoints Again
%1s should have seen the writing on the wall. After a poor pre-season, he still played %2s, who's bad form continued. We'll see how much longer can he hold onto his place in the starting lineup.
%1s should have seen the writing on the wall. After a poor pre-season, she still played %2s, who's bad form continued. We'll see how much longer can he hold onto his place in the starting lineup.
Poor Pre-Season Costs %1s His Place

The poor form of %1s in pre-season cost him dear, as %2s left him out of the %3s team for the opening game of the season. The player was still upbeat when talking to the press after the game. "It didn't come as a big surprise, as I've not found my form yet since coming back from the break. I'm working hard on my fitness levels, and I'm sure my game will return soon. I don't blame the boss for the decision he made."

Showing good promise during the pre-season, %1s got a surprise chance to begin the season on the team sheet against %2s. He showed that he could make the step up as he performed admirably. The performance will not give %3s a dilemma for his team selections going forward.

%1s Blows His Chance

After gaining %1s's confidence due to good performances in the pre-season tournament, %2s failed to deliver when it mattered. It's doubtful whether or not he'll get another chance with more established players waiting in the wings.

After gaining %1s's confidence due to good performances in the pre-season tournament, %2s failed to deliver when it mattered. It's doubtful he'll get another chance with more established players waiting in the wings.
Disappointment As %1s Is Left Out

Despite some match winning performances in pre-season, %1s was left out of the team for the season opener against %2s. "Yes, it was disappointing to not get the opportunity to play today, as I thought I did well in pre-season. I'll keep working hard in training and I hope to be given a chance at some point in the season.", he said.
Is %1s in line for more appearances?
There were plenty of positives in pre-season, including some of %1s's performances. Has he done enough to start making more first-team appearances for you?
I won't take risks.
The lad had a good pre-season and I hope he'll build on that. But we're up against an experienced %2s team here, so I'm not sure today's the right day to be giving a start to %1s.
He knows he's on my mind.
Pre-season is about getting fit and about showing the coach what you can do. %1s has done well. He's been very impressive and he knows I'm looking at giving him chances in the first team now.
He's got real desire.
There's plenty of competition for places here, but I've got to say I've been really impressed with %1s's attitude. He's worked very hard at his game and he's clearly desperate to play. I like that.
Why did you leave %1s out today?
Plenty of people were impressed with what they saw from %1s in pre-season. But he wasn't involved today. What was the thinking behind you leaving him out?
I went with experience.
To be honest, I just felt I wanted to kick off with a more experienced and familiar line-up. But %1s knows he's on mind. He did enough in pre-season to show everyone he's ready to play.
I pick the team for a particular game.
This isn't personal or a reflection on %1s's ability. He was great in pre-season and he'll get games, for sure. I just picked what I thought was the right team for today. That's my job, right?
%1s just needs to keep going.

Very good in pre-season. Very good in training. I've got no doubt that %1s has a real future here. He's in my thoughts and he'll play, I promise. Right now, though, it's up to him to just work hard and be ready.
%1s Misses Out

%1s was disappointed but in a reflective mood after the first game of the new season. After he'd played a major part in pre-season, he'd hoped he would get the call to be in the team for the opening day. However %2s decided not to include the fringe player, and so he was forced to watch the game from the stands hoping that he can force his way into the first team picture soon.

%1s was disappointed but in a reflective mood after the first game of the new season. After he'd played a major part in pre-season, he'd hoped he would get the call to be in the team on the opening day. However %2s decided not to include the fringe player, and so he was forced to watch the game from the stand hoping that he can force his way into the first team picture soon.
Does %1s look like a future %2s star?
%1s impressed everyone in pre-season and he's carried that form over into competitive games with the first team. Do you think %2s could have a star of the future on their hands?
Let's not put pressure on the lad.

Of course I'm very pleased with %1s's progress so far. But let's not put extra pressure on the lad. He's got plenty to learn and it's a long season. It's up to him now to keep working hard on his game.
There's more to come from him, I'm sure.
The lad's made great strides already. I gave %1s the chance to show what he could do in a competitive game and he came through that test. There's more to come from him, that's for sure.
He looks the part, doesn't he?
%1s's attitude during pre-season really set him apart. He threw himself into every training session and every game. He's forced his way into the first team and he doesn't look at all out of place.
Is it too big a step up for %1s?
He had such a promising pre-season, everybody thought %1s looked ready to make his mark. But today's performance wasn't at that level at all. Are we expecting too much too soon from him?
It's about coping with pressure.

The lad's got talent. But expectations bring extra pressure and that's why %1s struggled, I think. He's got plenty to learn as a player and I hope he recognises that now. Today was a reality check for him.
It's about self-confidence now.
I'm sure the lad's got what he needs to have a really good career in the game. It's about believing in himself now when he's pitched in at a higher level. I'm sure he'll prove himself soon enough.
I'm sure the lad's got what he needs to have a really good career in the game. It's about believing in himself now when he's pitched in at a higher level. I'm sure he'll prove himself soon enough.
The lad will learn from today.

I think %1s can become a real player for us. But he's still got plenty of growing up to do, that's obvious. I'm looking for a reaction from him after today. Every good player learns from his mistakes.

I think %1s can become a real player for us. But he's still got plenty of growing up to do, that's obvious. I'm looking for a reaction from him after today. Every good player learns from his mistakes.
%2s Decides Not To Keep Faith With %1s

When the day started %1s had high hopes of taking part in the match against %4s. However, despite a pre-season full of promising displays, he was left out of the %3s team by %2s. "I was impressed with what %1s did in the friendly games, so he's certainly on my mind. But today I decided to go with an alternative lineup. " said the manager after the match.

"I was impressed with what %1s did in the warm up games, so he's certainly on my mind. But today I decided to go with an alternative lineup. " said the manager after the match.
%2s Decides Not To Keep Faith With %1s

When the day started %1s had high hopes of taking part in the match against %4s. However, despite a pre-season full of promising displays, he was left out of the %3s team by %2s. "I was impressed with what %1s did in the friendly games, so he's certainly on my mind. But today I wanted to go with a more familiar lineup." said the manager after the match.

When the day dawned %1s had high hopes of taking part in the match against %4s. However, despite a pre-season full of promising displays, he was left out of the %3s team by %2s. "I was impressed with what %1s did in the warm up games, so he's certainly on my mind. But today I wanted to go with a more familiar lineup." said the manager after the match.
Will you stick with %1s?
Pre-season's been difficult for %1s. He's struggled for form and for fitness. Now the season's here and you've got tough decisions to make. Will you stick by him for the opening game?
Every player has to earn his place.

We've got a strong squad at the club now and real competition for places. Nobody gets a place in the starting line-up on the basis of reputation here. If %1s wants to play, he's going to have to find a bit of form.
Nobody's an automatic starter here.
It's the same for every player. If you want to be in the starting line-up, you've got to work hard and prove you deserve your place. %1s knows that and I'm just hoping he's up to the challenge.
%1s is a big player for us at %2s.
He didn't have a great time of it in pre-season but %1s is a big player for us here at %2s. We know what he can do. I'm confident he'll find his best form once we get into competitive games.
Is %1s's place under threat?
%1s has been such an important player for you in the past but he struggled in pre-season and you left him out today. Is his first-team position under threat now here at %2s?
I have to pick players in form.

It's tough. %1s is still a really important player for the football club but he'll be back, I'm sure. But, right now, I have to pick the players I think are in form and are ready to go out and win games
It's the same for everyone.

I can't carry players here. Nobody's going to get a place in the team based on past reputation. If you're in form, you play. If you're struggling, you don't. It's simple. And it's the same for everyone.
%1s has to put the work in now.
Every player will have difficult times in his career. %1s knows he's not at his best right now. It's up to him. He has to work hard in training if he's going to earn his place back in my starting XI.
Every player will have difficult times in his career. %1s knows he's not at his best right now. It's up to him. He has to work hard in training if he's going to earn his place back in my starting XI.
Are you glad you stuck by %1s?

After a difficult pre-season, %1s's position seemed to be under threat. You decided to stick by him, though, and he looked back to his best today. But was it a difficult decision to include him in the line-up?
He needs to find some consistency.

%1s knows I rate him as a player and of course I'm happy to see him put in a good performance. But he knows he'll need to find some consistency if he's going to be a regular in our starting line-up from now on.
I'm happy to see %1s able to bounce back so quickly after his poor pre-season but he needs to keep a streak of good performances if he wants to cement his role in the squad.
%1s will build on this performance.
I think we know what we're going to get from %1s over a season. It may take him a little time to find his best form but, once he does, we know he's able to put in consistently good performances.
It won't get any easier for him.
I was pleased %1s put in a performance today. He was much better than he's been in pre-season. But that's not the end of it. Over the season, he knows I'll have to challenge him again and again
Is time running out for %1s?
In pre-season, he wasn't anywhere near the level we expect from him. And today %1s was pretty unimpressive again. Do you think time may be up soon on his career at the club?
We can't wait forever.
I was hoping that %1s would give me a response now competitive games are starting again. But today was disappointing, wasn't it? Look, it's up to him. We can't carry passengers at this club.
Every player has to deal with tough times.
Every player has times when things don't go their way. %1s is no different. But I believe in him. He'll work hard to find his form and, if I can help him do that, he knows I'm here for him.
Things will turn around, I'm sure.

The season's only just kicked off. %1s may be struggling a little right now but we know what he offers us. If his attitude's right and he keeps working hard, I'm absolutely sure he's good enough to turn things around.

%1s's performance has been disappointing but the season has just started and he has plenty of time to regain his touch. If he keeps the right attitude and learns from his mistakes I'm sure we'll see him bounce back to his old ways in no time
%1s Left Out of %2s Team

%1s took to the field for the opening game of the season without one of their star names. A series of poor performances in pre-season had led to %2s choosing to leave %3s out of the season opener. "%3s is a key player in our squad even though he's had a rough patch lately. He'll get a chance to bounce back but today I wanted to go with a lineup based on the recent form from pre-season." said the %1s boss.
